text: Robert Lansing (October 17, 1864 â€“ October 30, 1928) was an American lawyer and diplomat who served as Counselor to the State Department at the outbreak of World War I, and then as United States Secretary of State under President Woodrow Wilson from 1915 to 1920. ==References== Category:1864 births Category:1928 deaths Category:United States Secretaries of State
title: Robert Lansing
